Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/9/25, one youth approached three other youth trying to
sneak out of the cottage. One youth brandished a knife and the
other two youth had lighters. The three youth ordered the other
youth to perform oral sex on them and further sexually assaulted
the youth. The youth smoked marijuana. A fifth youth witnessed
some of the altercation.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on 6/13/2025 via telephone.
There was no additional information to share.
Director of Residential (DR) was interviewed face to face on
6/17/25. DR reported being onsite when Youth A, Youth B, Youth
C, Youth D, and Youth E went AWOL. DR reported all youth were
supervised by staff members until going AWOL. DR reported Staff
1 followed Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D. It was
reported Youth E later joined the group of boys. DR reported
Youth E refused to go back into his cabin so he AWOL‘d and DR
reported following Youth E. DR reported all youth walked the
facility and returned for dinner. However, shortly after dinner,
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth D and Youth E ran out of the
cottage and into the woods. DR reported Staff 1 sent a text
message to her as the on-call supervisor and staff indicating he
had line of sight on Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and
Youth E.
Chief Administrator was interviewed on 6/17/25 face to face at
Methodist. Chief Administrator (CA) reported being aware of the
incident involving Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth
E. Chief Administrator reported all youth were supervised until line
of sight was lost according to the reports received from her staff
members. CA reported once line of sight is lost, staff members are
to notify Redford Police Department immediately and complete a
missing persons report. It was reported that while this is being
completed, staff members are to continue the search until the
youth are located and returned safely. CA expressed no concerns
2

for Staff 1 or Staff 2 and believes both staff followed the AWOL
policy and procedure.
Youth A was interviewed on 6/17/25 face to face at Methodist.
Youth A reported being inside his cottage around 7:15pm when
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E knocked on his window
to go outside. Youth A reported he was asked to come outside, so
he did. Youth A reported staff members are always watching the
youth and there is not a time in which the youth are not
supervised. Youth A reported being inside Cottage Grey with
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E. Youth A reported Staff
1 tried to convince him not to leave the building, but he decided to
leave anyways. Youth A reported seeing a vape pen and a bag of
marijuana at the cottage and reported all youth decided to smoke.
Youth A reported Youth B asked him if he wanted to have sex and
he felt pressured to do so. Youth A reported all youth except for
Youth E inserted their penis into his anus. Youth A reported lying
to law enforcement about being pressured to do so and reported
the act was consensual. Youth A reported telling Staff 1 about the
incident once it was over. Youth A reported prior to going into the
Cottage, Staff 1 followed the Youth until they were out of his line
of sight. Youth A reported seeing Staff 1 leave the area when Staff
1 could no longer see him and the other youth. Youth A reported
believing Staff 1 left to make a police report.
Youth B was interviewed on 6/17/2025 face to face at
Methodist. Youth B was observed to have two black eyes and a
scratch on his forehead. Youth B reported being beat up by Youth
A. Youth B refused to move forward in the interview because he
did not want to discuss what happened in Cottage Grey. Youth B,
however did state, he left the Cottage and Staff 1 was following
him and the other youth.
Youth C was interviewed on 6/17/25 face to face at Methodist.
Youth C reported after dinner, he, Youth B, and Youth D left the
cottage. Youth C reported telling Staff members that he was
leaving but did not recall if Staff 1 followed him. Youth C reported
making it to Cottage Grey without being seen. Once in the
building, Youth C reported he and the other youth smoked vape
pens and got high. Youth C reported he got the vape pen from
another youth but would not disclose the name. Youth C denied
receiving the vape pen and marijuana from another staff member.
Youth C reported being the person who suggested having a “fuck
fest” and suggested Youth E leave. Youth C reported he and the
other youth locked Youth E in a closet until the act was over.
Youth C reported Youth E told him he would tell staff, so Youth C
3

was placed in the closet until the act was over. Youth C reported
they were in the Cottage for about 15 minutes but no staff
members came to Cottage Grey. Youth C reported after they were
done, he saw Staff 1 outside walking around the Cottage. Youth C
reported earlier in the day going into Cottage Grey for Group.
Youth C reported going to the bathroom and unlocking the back
entrance door with the plan to go back later that night. Youth C
reported he and Youth B discussed breaking into Cottage Grey.
Youth D was interviewed face to face on 6/17/25 at Methodist.
Youth D reported going AWOL. Youth D reported Staff 1 tried to
redirect him but he did not listen. Youth D reported Staff 1
followed him until he ran into the woods. Youth D reported after
leaving the woods, he went to Cottage Grey to where Youth B,
Youth C, and Youth A were present. Youth D reported getting a
lighter from a dollar store when he AWOL’d. He denied smoking
marijuana and reported they were smoking looseleaf paper.
Youth D admitted to doing inappropriate sexual acts to Youth A
but refused to say the details. Youth D reported there being no
knife and denied making threats to Youth A with his lighter.
Youth E was interviewed face to face on 6/17/2025 at
Methodist. Youth E reported going AWOL from the facility. Youth
E reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to redirect him, but he decided
not to listen and ran with the other Youth. Youth E reported Staff 1
and Staff 2 followed him until he was out of their line of sight.
Youth E reported making it to Cottage Grey where no staff knew
where he was. Youth E reported Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D told him not to tell. Youth E reported he did not participate
in having sex nor did he smoke marijuana. Youth E reported he
was told not to look while the act was occurring. Youth E reported
being in Cottage Grey for more than 15 minutes. Youth E reported
once everything was over, he and the other youth turned
themselves into the midnight team.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face on 6/17/2025 at
Methodist. Staff 1 reported at the beginning of his shift, Youth A
left his Cottage to get Youth E. Staff 1 reported following Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C around the campus of Methodist until they
disappeared into the woods. Staff 1 reported trying to redirect the
youth by using de-escalation techniques, but the youth insisted
and took off into the woods. Staff 1 reported DR and Staff 2
followed Youth E once he joined the group of youth. Staff 1
reported making an attempt for 15 minutes to locate the youth but
was unsuccessful. Staff 1 reported once the youth was out of his
line of sight, he went to file a police report. Upon returning, Staff 1
4

reported seeing Staff 2 talking to Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
Youth D, and Youth E by Grey Cottage. Staff 1 denied the youth
told him Youth A was raped.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 7/11/2025. Staff 2
reported being present the day Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth
D, and Youth E went AWOL. However, Staff 2 reported he only
searched Youth A upon his return back to his Cottage. Staff 2
reported he was told that Youth A could not return to his Cottage
and to search him to clear him from coming back from AWOL.
Staff 2 denied he was the staff member to follow the youth. Staff 2
reported he had been at a different Cottage his entire shift and
was only asked to search Youth A upon his return from AWOL.
Staff 2 reported witnessing Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth D,
and Youth E Walk around the campus grounds. Staff 2 reported
seeing Staff 1 follow the youth on foot and then by car off grounds.
Staff 3 was interviewed via face to face on 6/30/2025. Staff 3
reported being on shift the day of the incident. Staff 3 reported
working at Cottage Grey. Staff 3 reported Youth C was at Cottage
Grey earlier in the day to complete group activity with Youth B.
Staff 3 reported all the youth left the building after finishing group
activity, but witnessed Youth A, Youth B, Youth C leave Cottage
Grey and refuse to go back to their assigned Cottages. Staff 3
reported seeing Staff 1 following Youth B and Youth C. Staff 3
reported being unsure how Youth C unlocked the back door but
believed it could have happened when he asked to use the
restroom. Staff 3 reported the bathroom being located next to the
back exit door.
Staff 4 was interviewed via face to face on 6/30/2025. Staff 4
reported working the day of the incident at Youth A’s Cottage.
Staff 4 reported writing an incident report after overhearing Youth
A say that he wasn’t being truthful about the incident between him
and the other youth. Staff 4 reported hearing Youth A tell Youth D
not to say anything about the incident. Staff 4 reported hearing
the youth go AWOL and reported staff members did go after the
youth, but is unsure who went, because she was passing
medication.

Incident Reports dated 6/9/2025 authored by Staff 1 documents

Incident Report dated 6/9/2025 authored by Staff 2 documents

Incident Report dated 6/9/25 authored by Staff 3 is consistent

AWOL Policy: This policy indicates when a Youth leaves the
grounds between 8:00am-6:00pm, the unit supervisor and shift
supervisor is immediately notified. If the incident occurs after
hours, the shift supervisor is immediately notified. Once staff loose
visual sight of the youth, The Redford police department is
notified. ‘If a youth tried to exit the building, he may stop utilizing
the appropriate verbal behavioral management interventions.
Youth cannot be restrained unless there is imminent risk present.
If a young person leaves MCHS grounds, a staff member should
get a van to follow the young person.If a young person AWOLs,
but stays on MCHS’ campus and goes into a wooded area, the
following steps should be taken:
• Contact shift supervisor immediately who will contact the
DORS.
• Staff must immediately follow a young person once they
exit from a designated area without permission. While
calmly following them, the staff member(s) must engage
with the young person verbally to attempt to return the
young person to their baseline behavior, so the young
person does not AWOL off grounds.
• Staff must follow the young as far as possible without
endangering their own safety. For example, if a young
person runs into the woods near the river, staff should
attempt to follow the exact same path of the young person
up until it creates physical risk of harm for the staff
person(s) (i.e. lose footing and slip, can’t fit into a small
6

young person’s size space, unable to maintain same level
of stamina of young person, etc.). At which point staff are
encouraged to maintain perimeter view to maintain or re-
establish eyesight of the young person.
• Staff should maintain phone contact and location
information with the Shift Supervisor until additional support
arrives, providing as detailed information as possible
regarding the young person’s exact location in the wooded
area.
• If a young person retreats further into the woods and staff
lose eyesight of the young person we must immediately
contact Redford Police Department and complete a missing
person’s report.
• While the report is being completed, staff should continue
to circulate the wooded area regularly to continue
attempting to re-establish eyesight of the young person and
return them to designated area safely.
• Police and Central Intake should be notified.
Young Person Supervision Policy: The policy outlines how
residential staff are to ensure youth safety through close, visible
supervision, reducing risks and supporting a healthy environment.
Staff use both visual and audio methods to supervise youth. They
are responsible for continuously observing behavior and being
attentive to verbal interactions between individuals and groups.
• Staff must always know each young person's location and
status, especially during transport. Youth outside must be
directly observed—not watched from indoors.
• A 3:1 staff-to-youth ratio is maintained during the day and
10:1 at night. Temporary exceptions (e.g., AWOL or
restraints) don’t mean the ratio is unmet due to extra staff
coverage.
• At night, staff must visually check each youth hourly and at
15-minute intervals, documenting from when they enter
their room until morning.
• Stay mobile and engaged: Staff must walk the milieu,
remain aware of all youth, and engage through
conversation and interaction. Focus on identifying strengths
like attitude and friendliness.
• Remain alert: Staff must stay awake and maintain an alert
posture. No lying down, reclining, or sitting immobile (e.g.,
on couches or benches).
• Medication disclosure: Any medication that may impact
alertness must be reported to the Assistant Cottage
Supervisor.
7

• Never leave youth unsupervised.
• No personal electronics: Headphones, earbuds, and other
personal devices are prohibited. Media (TVs, radios, etc.)
must be kept at a low volume to ensure supervision.
• Cell phone use is restricted: Only for emergencies and
must be stored securely. Staff should use designated
landlines. Supervisors, therapists, and FTCs may use cell
phones for work-related tasks.
Corewell Health Hospital/Avalon Healing Discharge
Paperwork: This document shows Youth A’s medical treatment
on 6/13/25. Youth A received STD/HIV testing. Youth A was also
prescribed Ceftriaxone (500mg) as a preventative medication.
Nurse Clinic Report dated 6/12/25: This document Youth C
report of being engaging in anal and oral sex with Youth A. Youth
A received STD/HIV testing.
Urgent Care Discharge Report dated 6/13/25. This documents
Youth D visit to the hospital for STD testing.
Analysis
The agency is found to be in compliance based on staff and youth
interviews. Staff 1, Staff 2, and DR reported that Staff 1 was
observed following Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and
Youth E until they were out of his line of sight. All youth
interviewed also reported that Staff 1 made efforts to follow and
redirect them but was unsuccessful. Per agency policy, staff
members are required to know the whereabouts of youth at all
times, and Staff 1 acted appropriately by following the youth until
they were no longer in sight. Staff 1 also followed the agency’s
AWOL protocol by notifying his on-call supervisor that the youth
went missing and by filing a police report with the Redford Police
Department.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
